column4: I have square text during boot and then nothing on a ubuntu server 11.10 box after fresh install. i installed sshd during the install so i do have access. any ideas how to fix?
boot loader and bios are fine
if you have sshd, then i guess you have everything :)
also, please be aware that Server installs do not have a GUI
what do you get when you press ctl+alt+f1 or f2
can you check if you have getty running? ps -fe|grep getty should tell you
yes i do
i added the nomodeset option and it said it did not recognize it but i got text at the terminal i still have squares during boot
could it be the nouveau driver? i have an nvidia card in there
do you also have an onboard video card?
no
its a nvidia 5200
i have no problems with older ubuntu and other linux distros i have tried with and without a gui
umm - can you change/add this entry in /etc/default/grub GRUB_GFXMODE=640x480 and then run update-grub2 and reboot
thats just for grub right? i dont have any problem with grub showing
oh ok, i thought you said you could see only squares
after the bootloader
when ubuntu is booting
why i was wondering if its a gfx driver. does the server version have any?
sorry but i gotta go; in any case, if the X server isnt getting started, the gfx driver doesnt have much role. it should be the console vga mode (in earlier kernels/grubs vga=791 helpd)
ok thx
